snippet: The derby has grown from a fairly simple afternoon event with a $2 admission fee to a prime-time spectacle with ticket prices as high as $2,000.
abstract: Extra Bases column; MLB All-Star Game Home Run Derby returns to its roots in Minnesota, but the 29th edition at Target Field will hardly resemble the first incarnation at the Metrodome in 1985; ticket prices have gone from $2 to as high as $2,000, and format has expanded from one round to four; other baseball items noted.

byline.contributor: Pat Borzi contributed reporting from Minneapolis.

lead_paragraph: The derby has grown from a fairly simple afternoon event with a $2 admission fee to a prime-time spectacle with ticket prices as high as $2,000.

headline.seo: All-Star Game Home Run Derby Returns to Minnesota in a Different Form
headline.main: Days of $2 Home Run Derby Are Long Gone
headline.print_headline: Days of $2 Home Run Derby Are Long Gone
